subject: Re: [junit] How do I make Unit Testing practical?
msgSnippet: ... They say that to successfully give up a habit, you have to replace it with something else.  How much time do others in your company spend in the debugger
messageBody:
Scott Palmer wrote:

>Another comment:
>I've been trying to get started with the unit testing and have been
>encouraging other's in my company to try it too, but I can't get any
>buy-in. I'm finding it difficult to get started so I don't really have
>a convincing argument for it other than "I've read that it is a great
>thing" :), obviously if I can make it work for me it would help. It's
>good to hear that others have had the same issues and have gotten past
>them. The examples make it look so simple and easy...
>
>

They say that to successfully give up a habit, you have to replace it
with something else. How much time do others in your company spend in
the debugger or otherwise trying to find the source of bugs? How much
time is spent designing software in a medium other than code that turns
out to be difficult (or awkward) to implement in code?

Mike
